message: The bill, which was sponsored by state Sens. Cam Ward, R-Alabaster, Gerald Dial, R-Lineville, and Tom Whatley, R-Auburn seeks to significantly enhance punishments for those found guilty of obstructing investigation into or aiding human trafficking offenses.

data.description: A locally sponsored bill aimed at bringing harsher punishments to those found guilty of aiding with human trafficking or interfering with the enforcement of the state’s human trafficking laws has passed the Alabama Legislature, and is now awaiting the governor’s signature.
data.title: Legislature passes locally sponsored bill to close human-trafficking ‘loophole’ | The Alabaster Reporter
